instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> beeping 3 times...
threads.message: Hi, this board is clean, has no corrosion, but had a short on the line: <SIGNAL>PPDDR_S3_REG</SIGNAL>, I injected voltage and found out that <CHIP>U3020</CHIP> was heating. Is it possible to put to work the board without one of the memory chips?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> beeping 3 times...
threads.message:
No way, all chips must be present.
A spike voltage could damaged more than one chip.
Be aware, even CPU is connected there...
